story:
Thanks so much for your support

The campaign is over, and we are very grateful for all the support we received. The new home for The Air Dock will be: TheAirDock.com

There you will be able to pre-order your Air Dock if you didn't get to during the campaign.




What is the Air Dock?

 

The Air dock is a wireless charging car dock for your smartphone. It holds your phone with no clips and no clamps 

 

It wirelessly charges your phone without plugging the phone into anything.

 


 

 

 

How does it work?

The face of the Air Dock is a micro suction foam that magically holds your phone in place. Inside the Air Dock are magnets that pull the phone tightly into the foam face.  


 

The Qi wireless charger is built into the dock. Any phone that supports Qi charging will automatically charge once placed on the Air Dock

 

 

Will my phone work on the Air 

Dock?

There are many phones that will work on the Air Dock. We are working on testing more and more phones all the time. Right now we can recommend a handful of phones to be used on the Air Dock. (We know there are more, but haven't tested them yet)

iPhone 5/4

 

 

 

Galaxy S4/3

 

 

Nexus 5/4

 

 

Galaxy Note 3/2

 

 

 

How does this magical foam work?

The micro suction foam face is pretty cool. Imagine a whole bunch of tiny little suction cups. That's what we have used to hold phones to the Air Dock. 

Full size suction cups need a smooth glossy surface to stick to. Similarly the micro suction foam needs a smooth glossy phone to hold onto. 

Any phone with a glossy back will stick great to the micro suction foam. If your phone isn't glossy on the back, then it's just a simple matter of putting it in a case that is smooth and glossy. 

 

Why use magnets to hold the 

phones?

Not all phones have a glossy back, and not all people want their phones in a case. To help make more phones work on the Air Dock we have added strategically placed magnets just under the surface of the Air Dock. 

Some phones(and tablets), including the Nexus 5, and the Nexus 7 have little metal discs embedded in the back plate of the phone. Our magnets line up with these metal discs, and pull quite nicely on them. 

Many phones have metal in their backs (the Galaxy phones all have some metal), so the magnets only help to hold the phone better. (More on each compatible phone below)

 

 

 

This thing is awesome! How do I 

get one? 

You can contribute in the amounts below and we will send you an Air Dock as a Perk to say thanks for supporting us.

 

 

 

 

 Or check out our Rewards Program to see how you can get your Air Dock for Free! 

 

 

 

 

Shipping Information

Please check the perk descriptions for the shipping costs to different parts of the world. We will ship internationally, but it does cost a little more. If you already contributed and forgot to add shipping, just use the $1 perk and adjust the amount to make up the difference. Thanks!

Each Air Dock comes with one suction cup mount, one micro USB cable, one 2 amp cigarette lighter to USB power supply. It's all ready to go with everything you need. 

 

 

 

Our Story

So far in this journey we have gone through dozens of prototypes. Getting the right grip from the pad has been key. We discovered early that the back of the phone needs to be glossy for the phone to stick to the Air Dock. This means that if you have a phone that doesn't have a glossy back you will need to get a case that is glossy. This isn't a problem for most phones, as they are already glossy backed.

We have had great success charging all phones through a case, as long as the case is not overly thick. Normal plastic cases, whether soft or hard work just fine, as long as they are glossy. 

The current working prototype has us really excited. Currently there are 6 of this version out in the real world getting used every day by our team of testers. (soon to be another 30 thanks to our "tester" backers!)

Greg, Our founder and CEO:

"I have been building things since I was a kid, and I love it. Building and testing the Air Dock has been a blast. I have used several different 3D printers to make all the different parts as I have experimented with different versions of the Air Dock. There is nothing I enjoy more than having an idea and then turning it into a finished and working product."

 

 

 

At the moment we are using a 3D printer to make a few parts for the Air Dock. The purpose of this campaign is to get a large enough order to have all the plastic parts injection molded and push us over the edge into large scale production. 

The electronics of the charger are all sorted and ready for full production. We have already made arrangements with the factory producing them.  A large quantity order is ready to be placed as soon as funding is accomplished.

 

What does the future hold?

We have the current version of the Air Dock perfected. There is no more design or functionality tweaking to be done. All we need at this point is enough funding to afford the high upfront cost of getting molds made for the Air Dock. We are really excited to get this version out there to people just like you!

We have received numerous requests and suggestions for ways to make future versions of the Air Dock better. A few of the ideas that we are considering are:

  • A magnetic version compatible with all phones
  • An NFC chip inside the Air Dock
  • An all black version 

We may try to implement some of these ideas into the current model of the Air Dock. It will depend on how much funding we get, and how smoothly everything goes! We are always up for a challenge! 

 

 

When will I get my Air Dock?

We are planning to have our first production run ship out in April 2014. If we sell out of these perks we will add additional perks for a second production run. This run will probably ship some time around June 2014 

 

 

Want to know more about your 

phone and the Air Dock?

Nexus 5

The Nexus 5 has little metal discs in the back plate of the phone that are placed right around the charging coil. We have magnets inside the Air Dock that align with these discs and pull on them to hold the phone in place. This works great for the black Nexus 5 because it's back isn't glossy and the micro-suction foam doesn't hold as firmly. The magnets instead do the holding. 

No matter which version of the Nexus 5 you have it will work great with the Air Dock. It will also work fine through a case, as long as the case is glossy, and not too thick.

 

 

 

 

Nexus 7

The nexus 7 has the same metal mounting discs in it's back as the Nexus 5. The black version is also just a little bit more glossy than it's Nexus 5 counterpart which helps make up for the extra weight of the Nexus 7. 

We have tested the Nexus 7 on the Air Dock and so far it is holding fine. We will continue testing for the Nexus 7 so that it can be used on the Air Dock. We think it's pretty cool that you can mount a full blown tablet on our Dock!

 


 

 

 

Galaxy S4

If you own a Galaxy S4 you have several options. 

  • Option 1 - Buy a Samsung brand replacement back cover for your phone. This back cover will have the wireless charging hardware built in. Once you have the new back cover, place your phone on the Air Dock and it will charge. The disadvantage to this option is that the replacement back cover is thicker than the original. This becomes a problem if you are trying to put your phone back into a hard case. If you don't use a case with your phone, this is a great option. This is also the highest quality receiver you can get. It is highly recommended. 
  • Option 2 - Buy an aftermarket wireless charging kit. This kit gets applied right over the battery under the original back cover. This keeps the phone closer to the same thickness so that it will fit more easily into a hard case. We will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)

 

 

 

 

Galaxy S3

If you own a Galaxy S3 you have several options. 

  • Option 1 - Buy a Samsung brand replacement back cover for your phone.(supposedly this back cover is only available through Verizon wireless for the S3) This back cover will have the wireless charging hardware built in. Once you have the new back cover, place your phone on the Air Dock and it will charge. The disadvantage to this option is that the replacement back cover is thicker than the original. This becomes a problem if you are trying to put your phone back into a hard case. If you don't use a case with your phone, this is a great option. This is also the highest quality receiver you can get. It is highly recommended. 
  • Option 2 - Buy an aftermarket wireless charging kit. This kit gets applied right over the battery under the original back cover. This keeps the phone closer to the same thickness so that it will fit more easily into a hard case. We will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)

 

 

Note 2/3

Only certain versions of the Note 2 support wireless charging. Please check that yours does. As of right now we have done little testing on the Note 2. There are aftermarket wireless charging kits available. We are under the impression that there is a Samsung brand back cover for the Note 3, but not the Note 2. We will be doing more reasearch into the Note 2 as the campaign progresses. We will update this as we learn more. Please do your own research to find out if it your phone supports wireless charging. 

The Note 3 does support wireless charging. Samsung makes a replacement wireless charging back cover for the Note 3 and we highly recommend this for your phone's receiver. There are aftermarket receivers as well, and we will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)

 

 

 

iPhone 5/4

If you own an iPhone then you must use a wireless charging compatible case with your phone. The wireless charging hardware is built into the back of the case, and the bottom of the case plugs into the power port for the phone. Once the iPhone is in the case then the phone will charge wirelessly. There are numerous of these cases to be had for both the iPhone 4 and the iPhone 5. If you buy your own please make sure that the back of it is glossy.  We will be testing these aftermarket cases and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They will be available in both white and black for the iPhone 5 and iPhone 4

 

 

Accountability

We promise to keep our supporters updated of the progress in production via email. Once we have taken delivery of the first batch of product, video and picture updates of the assembly and packaging processes will be sent. We promise to run a transparent campaign, and will share our successes and challenges with our backers. 

 

 

 

Risks and Challenges

We have already contacted the factories that will be supplying the parts, and they are ready for large orders. Of course it's possible to face delays in getting product, but we feel that we have built in a good buffer. Scaling production to match a high demand and a tight schedule is something our team has dealt with numerous times in the professional world. We are ready and excited to take on this new project. We will work very hard to get you an awesome product in an even more awesome time frame.
story_txt:
Thanks so much for your supportThe campaign is over, and we are very grateful for all the support we received. The new home for The Air Dock will be: TheAirDock.comThere you will be able to pre-order your Air Dock if you didn't get to during the campaign.What is the Air Dock?

		 

The Air dock is a wireless charging car dock for your smartphone. It holds your phone with no clips and no clamps 



		 

It wirelessly charges your phone without plugging the phone into anything.

		 



		 

 

		 

How does it work?

The face of the Air Dock is a micro suction foam that magically holds your phone in place. Inside the Air Dock are magnets that pull the phone tightly into the foam face.  



		 

The Qi wireless charger is built into the dock. Any phone that supports Qi charging will automatically charge once placed on the Air Dock

		 

		 

Will my phone work on the Air 

Dock?

There are many phones that will work on the Air Dock. We are working on testing more and more phones all the time. Right now we can recommend a handful of phones to be used on the Air Dock. (We know there are more, but haven't tested them yet)

iPhone 5/4


		 



		 

		 

Galaxy S4/3


		 



		 

Nexus 5/4


		 



		 

Galaxy Note 3/2


		 



		 

		 

How does this magical foam work?

The micro suction foam face is pretty cool. Imagine a whole bunch of tiny little suction cups. That's what we have used to hold phones to the Air Dock. 

Full size suction cups need a smooth glossy surface to stick to. Similarly the micro suction foam needs a smooth glossy phone to hold onto. 

Any phone with a glossy back will stick great to the micro suction foam. If your phone isn't glossy on the back, then it's just a simple matter of putting it in a case that is smooth and glossy. 

		 

Why use magnets to hold the 

phones?

Not all phones have a glossy back, and not all people want their phones in a case. To help make more phones work on the Air Dock we have added strategically placed magnets just under the surface of the Air Dock. 

Some phones(and tablets), including the Nexus 5, and the Nexus 7 have little metal discs embedded in the back plate of the phone. Our magnets line up with these metal discs, and pull quite nicely on them. 

Many phones have metal in their backs (the Galaxy phones all have some metal), so the magnets only help to hold the phone better. (More on each compatible phone below)

		 



		 

		 

This thing is awesome! How do I 

get one? 

You can contribute in the amounts below and we will send you an Air Dock as a Perk to say thanks for supporting us.

		 

		 








 

		 

 Or check out our Rewards Program to see how you can get your Air Dock for Free! 

 

		 

		 

		 

Shipping Information

Please check the perk descriptions for the shipping costs to different parts of the world. We will ship internationally, but it does cost a little more. If you already contributed and forgot to add shipping, just use the $1 perk and adjust the amount to make up the difference. Thanks!

Each Air Dock comes with one suction cup mount, one micro USB cable, one 2 amp cigarette lighter to USB power supply. It's all ready to go with everything you need. 

		 

		 

		 

Our Story

So far in this journey we have gone through dozens of prototypes. Getting the right grip from the pad has been key. We discovered early that the back of the phone needs to be glossy for the phone to stick to the Air Dock. This means that if you have a phone that doesn't have a glossy back you will need to get a case that is glossy. This isn't a problem for most phones, as they are already glossy backed. 

We have had great success charging all phones through a case, as long as the case is not overly thick. Normal plastic cases, whether soft or hard work just fine, as long as they are glossy. 

The current working prototype has us really excited. Currently there are 6 of this version out in the real world getting used every day by our team of testers. (soon to be another 30 thanks to our "tester" backers!)

Greg, Our founder and CEO:

"I have been building things since I was a kid, and I love it. Building and testing the Air Dock has been a blast. I have used several different 3D printers to make all the different parts as I have experimented with different versions of the Air Dock. There is nothing I enjoy more than having an idea and then turning it into a finished and working product."

		 



 

		 

At the moment we are using a 3D printer to make a few parts for the Air Dock. The purpose of this campaign is to get a large enough order to have all the plastic parts injection molded and push us over the edge into large scale production. 

The electronics of the charger are all sorted and ready for full production. We have already made arrangements with the factory producing them.  A large quantity order is ready to be placed as soon as funding is accomplished.

		 

What does the future hold?

We have the current version of the Air Dock perfected. There is no more design or functionality tweaking to be done. All we need at this point is enough funding to afford the high upfront cost of getting molds made for the Air Dock. We are really excited to get this version out there to people just like you!

We have received numerous requests and suggestions for ways to make future versions of the Air Dock better. A few of the ideas that we are considering are:


A magnetic version compatible with all phones


An NFC chip inside the Air Dock


An all black version 


We may try to implement some of these ideas into the current model of the Air Dock. It will depend on how much funding we get, and how smoothly everything goes! We are always up for a challenge! 

		 

		 

When will I get my Air Dock?

We are planning to have our first production run ship out in April 2014. If we sell out of these perks we will add additional perks for a second production run. This run will probably ship some time around June 2014 

		 



		 

Want to know more about your 

phone and the Air Dock?

Nexus 5


The Nexus 5 has little metal discs in the back plate of the phone that are placed right around the charging coil. We have magnets inside the Air Dock that align with these discs and pull on them to hold the phone in place. This works great for the black Nexus 5 because it's back isn't glossy and the micro-suction foam doesn't hold as firmly. The magnets instead do the holding. 

No matter which version of the Nexus 5 you have it will work great with the Air Dock. It will also work fine through a case, as long as the case is glossy, and not too thick.



		 

		 

		 

		 

Nexus 7


The nexus 7 has the same metal mounting discs in it's back as the Nexus 5. The black version is also just a little bit more glossy than it's Nexus 5 counterpart which helps make up for the extra weight of the Nexus 7. 

We have tested the Nexus 7 on the Air Dock and so far it is holding fine. We will continue testing for the Nexus 7 so that it can be used on the Air Dock. We think it's pretty cool that you can mount a full blown tablet on our Dock!

		 



		 

		 

		 

Galaxy S4


If you own a Galaxy S4 you have several options. 


Option 1 - Buy a Samsung brand replacement back cover for your phone. This back cover will have the wireless charging hardware built in. Once you have the new back cover, place your phone on the Air Dock and it will charge. The disadvantage to this option is that the replacement back cover is thicker than the original. This becomes a problem if you are trying to put your phone back into a hard case. If you don't use a case with your phone, this is a great option. This is also the highest quality receiver you can get. It is highly recommended. 



Option 2 - Buy an aftermarket wireless charging kit. This kit gets applied right over the battery under the original back cover. This keeps the phone closer to the same thickness so that it will fit more easily into a hard case. We will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)


		 



		 

		 

		 

Galaxy S3


If you own a Galaxy S3 you have several options. 


Option 1 - Buy a Samsung brand replacement back cover for your phone.(supposedly this back cover is only available through Verizon wireless for the S3) This back cover will have the wireless charging hardware built in. Once you have the new back cover, place your phone on the Air Dock and it will charge. The disadvantage to this option is that the replacement back cover is thicker than the original. This becomes a problem if you are trying to put your phone back into a hard case. If you don't use a case with your phone, this is a great option. This is also the highest quality receiver you can get. It is highly recommended. 



Option 2 - Buy an aftermarket wireless charging kit. This kit gets applied right over the battery under the original back cover. This keeps the phone closer to the same thickness so that it will fit more easily into a hard case. We will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)


		 

		 

Note 2/3


Only certain versions of the Note 2 support wireless charging. Please check that yours does. As of right now we have done little testing on the Note 2. There are aftermarket wireless charging kits available. We are under the impression that there is a Samsung brand back cover for the Note 3, but not the Note 2. We will be doing more reasearch into the Note 2 as the campaign progresses. We will update this as we learn more. Please do your own research to find out if it your phone supports wireless charging. 

The Note 3 does support wireless charging. Samsung makes a replacement wireless charging back cover for the Note 3 and we highly recommend this for your phone's receiver. There are aftermarket receivers as well, and we will be testing different brands of these and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They are aftermarket and are not as high of quality as the Samsung brand back cover. (they are a little bit cheaper though)

		 

		 

		 

iPhone 5/4


If you own an iPhone then you must use a wireless charging compatible case with your phone. The wireless charging hardware is built into the back of the case, and the bottom of the case plugs into the power port for the phone. Once the iPhone is in the case then the phone will charge wirelessly. There are numerous of these cases to be had for both the iPhone 4 and the iPhone 5. If you buy your own please make sure that the back of it is glossy.  We will be testing these aftermarket cases and recommending/supplying the one we find works best. They will be available in both white and black for the iPhone 5 and iPhone 4

		 



		 

Accountability


We promise to keep our supporters updated of the progress in production via email. Once we have taken delivery of the first batch of product, video and picture updates of the assembly and packaging processes will be sent. We promise to run a transparent campaign, and will share our successes and challenges with our backers. 

		 

		 

		 

Risks and Challenges


We have already contacted the factories that will be supplying the parts, and they are ready for large orders. Of course it's possible to face delays in getting product, but we feel that we have built in a good buffer. Scaling production to match a high demand and a tight schedule is something our team has dealt with numerous times in the professional world. We are ready and excited to take on this new project. We will work very hard to get you an awesome product in an even more awesome time frame.

story:
The redefined Compact PC Case - meet the Defcon One

PER LA VERSIONE ITALIANA CLICCATE QUA! 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IEEza9_u9GU...


As seen on 

 

http://goo.gl/pOBMd4      http://goo.gl/KniRPb

   

NVidia Italia                                      Hardware Ready
http://goo.gl/wydmQO              http://goo.gl/0XMe5b

Quertymag
http://goo.gl/tVjoAS


The Project

Hello everyone,

I present to you the DefconOne, a revolution in compact PC cases.
Technology is all around us; we all have some sort of computer, be it a notebook, a tablet or a desktop PC.

Think about the desktop; the first thing that comes to mind is the PC case. The PC encloses all the other parts of the computer and has to be both functional and good looking.

We started this project by taking a look around and asking ourselves: “How can we improve upon the key features of a PC case, the size and it’s modularity?” – the answer we got was the DefconOne. 


The DefconOne is a compact PC case that in just 30 cm of length allows you to have the uncompromised performance you dream of, without sacrificing your ability to choose the components.


But the DefconOne is not just a marvel of engineering, it’s also designed to be stunning. The first thing you will notice are the two opening that allow you to have your Nvidia or AMD graphic cards always in view, for an aggressive, yet elegant look.

With the DefconOne we really wanted to push the limits of computer case engineering by delivering you the smallest and best performing case that could be designed.


For those who want to see all the technical data of our amazing product, here they are. 

Width: 16cm
Length: 30cm
Height: 37cm
Motherboards supported: micro-ATX up to 240x240mm
Graphic cards supported: 2 graphic cards up to 280mm
Storage: up to 4 drives, 3.5" and 2.5"
Cooling: Liquid cooling for the CPU with 120mm fan

You and Us

To make the DefconOne a reality, we need your support, so here is what we'll do with your contributions:

  •  We'll make the prototypes and get started manufacturing asap.

  • We'll improve the product based on your feedback

  • We'll reinvest 70/90% of the revenues into new product creation


But of course we don't just ask you to believe in us, we also give you something back

  • Starting at the 10 euro contribution, you get a discount on the case, which increases with the increase of the contribution, in addition to cool gadgets like shirts and customized USB. If your contribution is high enough, you may even become a part of the team and get a share!

  • The first 1000 cases will all be numbered, and the first 100 will be a limited edition with a few special features

  • Before contributing, you may send us the name of your favourite graphic card and we'll show you what they will look like on the DefconOne; just email us at codenamedefconone@hotmail.com and we'll send you the final result asap!

Here is what the DefconOne looks like with 2 GTX980s ;)


A few more details

Thanks to the first contributions we are now getting the prototypes ready, and if everythign goes as scheduled, we'll have production ready by the end of November. For any questions you may have email us at codenamedefconone@hotmail.com, or visit out facebook page - DefconOne

story:
Stay engaged in the conversation.

Writing or typing takes your attention away from what's going on around you. Cogi lets you take down what was just said with a single finger tap, so your attention can stay with the room.

How does it work?

Cogi keeps the last few moments of audio buffered. When someone says something interesting, just tap the highlight button and Cogi backs up to capture and save what was just said. When the moment has passed, just tap again and Cogi will stop highlighting. You can have as many highlights in a session as you like.

Real screenshots from a real app available on the Google Play Store.

Spend less time reviewing.

Since Cogi only records the important moments, you can review exactly what was said without wasting time on all the jibber-jabber. Attach photos, videos and even text notes (if you’re still into that sort of thing). You can review images, transcriptions and text notes while listening to your highlights. You can also add tags and contacts to your sessions to give even more context.

No joke, you can take Cogi home today with nothing down and zero interest... ever... because it’s free.

How do our early adopters like it?

“Play Store is clogged with apps that reinvent the wheel (same or less features then built-in stock app). Recording apps are no exception. The Cogi recording app on the other hand is one of those gems that offers something new to the table. For this I give "Cogi" 5+ well deserved stars.”
–
Farbror F.

“Unbelievably useful app. Brilliant, simple idea and very useful app. Strangely enough, even though I needed something like this many times (and I'm certainly not the only one), I couldn't find anything even remotely useful. Congratulations.”
–
Robert P.

“Perfect. I would pay for this! Perfect.”
–
Francois B.


“So far... awesome. Recording every minute of a board meeting was nuts. This is awesome…”
–
David B.

"Best I Ever Had The Cogi app is a masterpiece. I think I've been missing something great like this when at a seminar last week and before that too. This app is one of its kind in the play store. Thank you very much for building Cogi for us."
-
Jay E.

"This is so beautifully simple yet very high quality! The whole app runs so smoothly without any problems what so ever! It's very easy to use and to learn how to put together really useful audio clips and attach things like pictures to them! I can't wait to see what features are going to be added in the future but saying that, I would have no complaints if there weren't any at all!"
-
Josh B.

“Best note taking app! Ever! Simply the best app for note taking! Initially thought frequent click of the button should yield different clips but it doesn't. The developers were indeed right in combining the highlights if they were close enough. Thanks for this app! Looking forward to great updates!”
–
Nikhil P.

“Excellent! It is indeed better than notes!”
–
Jid L.

Download the Cogi App for Android

So, here’s what we’ve done so far...

Over the past several years, the Cogi team has put in a ton of work and has developed substantial technology, including:

An MVP Android app with a great experience, available here.

An equivalent iPhone alpha, available very soon.

Telephone infrastructure to support conference bridging.

Workflow software to provide high quality, fast turnaround, cost effective transcription, with better than 98% accuracy for adequate-quality audio.

Media storage within Cogi's cloud infrastructure in support of user's captured content.

And here’s what we still need to do...

We need your help to complete and release our solution. Here are the project goals:

Complete the development of our iPhone application.

Integrate the iPhone and Android mobile solutions with the existing back-end services, including telephone infrastructure and our cloud-based transcription engine.

Expand our media systems to support the new media types that are included in the new mobile applications, namely image and eventually video content.

Expand our language localizations to Spanish, Portuguese, French, German and Russian, allowing us to support a more diverse user community.

Fund the initial market launch campaigns.

A very technical diagram that explains everything.

Campaign Perks

All who participate in this campaign are invited to the exclusive Cogi Membership Beta, where the extended services are enabled and launched. These extended capabilities include media storage in the cloud, the ability to use Cogi on phone calls, and high-quality transcription of the audio highlights. The duration of each membership level is defined, from six months to two years. Campaign members also get special discounted pricing on transcription and telephony for the duration of their memberships.

Standard Cogi Membership

Cogi is free to download and free to use. However, a Cogi membership gives you access to our premium features, such as: transcription, telephony, cloud storage and more.

Plus, 25 minutes free transcription per month!

Phone minutes are for domestic calling only.

Campaign Schedule

We are working on all facets of our solutions, and the following is the high-level schedule for each phase of the service launch:

Android Mobile App (Released): Download at the Play Store

iPhone Mobile App: April 15, 2014

Android Full Service Launch: May 15, 2014

iPhone Full Service Launch: July 1, 2014

We will updated these schedules as we get close to each release.

Who are we?

Cogi was formed by a group of technologists and entrepreneurs who have worked in the communications space for their entire careers. The pain point of trying to capture the important points from a meeting, a lecture, and especially a phone call led to the creation of a communications platform specifically designed to make it trivial for anyone to capture these ideas, and just as importantly, be able to leverage that content.

And, as we all know, in today’s world, our lives are inundated with images and sounds… So, the application can capture the highlights of what we see and hear. Think of this as a highlight reel for your day, whether you are a student attending lectures all day or, like the rest of us, participating in meetings or various phone calls throughout our day.

Our goals are to make it easier for everyone to leverage what they see and hear, all the while ensuring that the focus can remain on the conversations at-hand and not on the tools we have created. We believe this is a big problem that faces so many of us, and we are confident that we are delivering a most compelling solution.

Let us know what you think!

Email us at feedback@cogi.com to let us know what you think about the applications or ideas that you might have to improve the services we are delivering.

Cogi Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Check out the answers to questions you might have. For many of these responses, we've included views of the application in action from our Android mobile app to help highlight the benefits of using Cogi.

What is Cogi?

It’s about focus, engagement and the sound bite...

Cogi provides the most intuitive mobile applications to be able to CAPTURE, REVIEW and SHARE the important moments from our conversations, meetings, lectures, interviews, and phone calls, all situations where someone should remain engaged on important content.

We have often considered these important moments as time periods from our day that needed to be highlighted. Sound bites are by definition a shorter piece of audio that represents a key idea of an longer audio segment, such as interviews, speeches, phone calls, etc. So, what Cogi allows you to do is capture these sound bites as they happen "in nature" and be able to easily and dynamically leverage those sound bites later.

So, how does Cogi work?

Cogi stands for "cogent idea". The concept is simple. As we hear things that are important, often we can't easily remember or capture them. So, wouldn't it be great if we could remain focused on the topic at hand and yet capture these fleeting moments easily?

The Cogi concept is to remain focused on the conversation by presenting an easy-to-use experience. When you decide it’s time to start listening for these important thoughts, just start a session by tapping on the interface.

With the session started, the Cogi application begins to buffer what you are listening to. Then, when something interesting is said, you tap the big Cogi button on your mobile application and a highlight is started. That’s it.

Cogi, just another recording application?

Yes, Cogi is a voice recording application. The “big idea” is to create an experience where you are focusing 100% of your attention on what you are listening to (ok, 99%, as you do have to tap that big Cogi button).

You remain engaged on the meeting, lecture or that important phone call from your most important client. We don't want you to worry about typing or writing or anything, especially on a mobile device.

And we do so much more than just recording the audio...

What about recording the entire meeting or lecture?

Seriously, if you recorded a 90-minute lecture or meeting that you sat through, what's the likelihood that you'd listen to it again?

Zero.

It wasn't necessarily that interesting the first time, or maybe it was, but who has the time to listen to all of it again? But there are usually valuable sound bites during that meeting or lecture. With Cogi, you can save those easily.

What about that "aha moment"?

While you are listening to whomever is talking, and you say to yourself, "Gee, I should write that down", you used to be required to change your focus and try to capture the idea on your computer or paper.

Now with Cogi, when you determine that something important is being said, you just tap that big Cogi button, and Cogi backs up to capture the context of what was said that drove that interest in the first place. You then just tap that button again when the "interesting" part of the conversation is over.

And don’t worry! We know that not everyone reacts the same. This back up feature is configurable to what works for each user. You can configure it from 5 seconds to 45 seconds, and that can be a lot of context!

We all brainstorm, so how to support the creative?

Just think about how many times someone said, “Oh, that was a great idea”, yet no one could remember exactly what was just said. With Cogi, you can essentially backup and capture these creative nuggets. It’s like a DVR for everything you hear (well, everything you hear that’s worth saving!).

How to create the highlight reel from your day?

Consider our football Sundays.

There are dozens of games, and perhaps we watch one or two.  But for most games, we count on watching the highlights of all the big plays from all the games.

With Cogi, you apply that same concept for your meetings, lectures and phone calls... just capture the sound bites and any other context that might be help, such as that great diagram on the whiteboard.

How does multitasking help me?

It doesn’t.

Many of us think that we are great at multitasking. The irony is that the comprehensive studies show that while multitasking, we are actually doing each task more poorly than if we focused on just one thing.

Stanford Communications Professor Dr. Clifford Nass stated that the only way to truly digest information that you are listening to would be to pause the speaker, reflect, take a note, or compose a question.

So, is taking notes a form of multitasking? We think so.

A solution like Cogi doesn’t quite achieve the objective of pausing the person speaking as Dr. Nass suggested, but it does capture that moment so that you can digest and/or reflect on it when convenient for you.

But, writing helps me remember… what am I missing?

We understand that for some people, the act of writing notes helps them remember and digest the content. We are not suggesting to always replace taking notes with Cogi. But, for so many situations, Cogi can capture things that note taking cannot.

And for those people that don’t take notes (or never have), Cogi can augment their ability to remember the key points from their day.

We often work in a hybrid model. Write notes where notes make sense. Use Cogi when there’s just too much information to digest or when that content is really important and can’t be lost.

Oh, and you can take a picture of any notes you do take and add that image to your active Cogi session, keeping all of that related content together in one place.

How does Cogi get all of what I need?

Sometimes it takes us a few seconds (or more!) to register that something important is being said.

But don’t worry, as Cogi is listening, just in case you needed that information. When you tap the highlight button, the Cogi application rewinds to record the context that led you to think to tap the button in the first place.

And for those of you that worry about when Cogi is actively listening, we only have the microphone active if you have started a session. Otherwise, we are just waiting for you to let us know when the important stuff has started.

What about what’s on the whiteboard or your own notes?

Cogi has even more tricks up its sleeve by allowing you to add text notes and pictures to your Cogi sessions to help you remember even more details from your meetings, lectures and conversations.

Think of a whiteboard where you drew diagrams or notes on and how nice it would be to see that content when reviewing your voice notes!

How do I keep track of all my valuable highlights?

You can tag your important highlights with a simple swipe and tap. Any time during a session, just slide from the right edge of the home screen or tap the tags icon on the home screen to easily add contact or text tags.

Contact tags typically reference a person’s name, such as @TheNameOfMyBoss. For text tags, the application has a number of predefined tags that you can use, like #FollowUp, or you can just add your own (e.g. #Photosynthesis).

How can I capture the highlights from phone calls?

You can just as easily capture these important highlights or sound bites on your phone calls, no longer trying to figure out how to remember important details when you are away from your desk.

Or, even if you are working from your office, taking a call and focusing on that call is important. Let Cogi capture the important sound bites. And, unlike most if not all of the mobile applications that claim to record phone calls, Cogi has built the infrastructure necessary to take the compelling and intuitive user experience and capture high-quality audio from of the call.

Ok, but is call recording legal?

Regulations vary from state to state (and country to country) regarding call recording. In the United States, most states (38 of them) are a "one party" consent state.  That means that if you want to and you are recording a call that you are participating on, then you are all good.

The other states are "all party" consent states, and as the name implies, everyone on the call must consent to the recording.

The bottom line is if you have reservations about consent, where applicable, then just have Cogi at the ready. Then, if and when the mood strikes, ask for consent. A simple example would be at the end of a long call where it's agreed to use Cogi for the final summary points and action items.

Just so many other cases...

The key to call recording regulations is that there are so many collaborative situations for almost everyone where call recording regulations are just not significant (e.g. collaboration with team where everyone already knows we are using Cogi).

Why does Cogi require calls to be routed through its systems?

Besides our clean user experience, which provides for a seamless environment for capturing the important highlights from your day, we built a scalable telephone infrastructure that allows us to capture the highest quality recordings from both or all sides of a telephone conversation.

Virtually all of the free recording applications in the app stores rely on hardware dependent and often unsupported capabilities of the mobile phones and mobile phone platforms to attempt to record phone calls. The results are inconsistent, device varying solutions.

With Cogi, you can count on a perfect recording every time. And, with Cogi, you know when you are invoking the recording function on a call, with its clean user interface depicting who’s on the call.

How do you associate highlights, images and tags from a session?

The killer review experience...

We've now captured these audio sound bites, images, video, contact tags, hashtags. What now? Listen to audio? Well, yes, we have to listen to the audio. But with Cogi's review experience, the user may have captured key images from the whiteboard or used contact tags to easily show who was in the meeting.

Thus, you can see who's participated (visually with the thumbnail pictures of the meeting participants) or view the content of the whiteboard, all while listening to these sound bites. Engage your brain looking at these visuals while you listen to the sound bites.

All of us can record audio, capture images and video and type notes in our phones with existing applications.  The key with Cogi is being able to capture these elements and put them all into one place to easily associate a given sound bite with an image from the whiteboard while also remembering who was participating in the meeting.

How does this help with disabilities?

Whether for students or business people, there are many who have different sets of challenges. After all, don’t most of us have difficulties with focus from time to time?

At colleges and universities, accessibility must be provided under Americans with Disabilities Act and other governmental regulations.  This is not just tied to students with vision, hearing or other physical impairments but to students with cognitive challenges (e.g. dyslexia, ADHD, etc.).

Accessibility departments exist at most schools, and they are continually looking for solutions to help their students with the learning process.

Using the Cogi app can be the “cool” way to remain focused and obviate the need to take notes while listening in the lecture, study session, office hours, etc. And, for most students, the free application form of Cogi’s solution should work just fine.

And as it works for students in these contexts, does that not help the rest of us?

What if you’re listening in a language that’s not native?

For learning or business contexts, listening to content in a different language can be a challenge, depending on your proficiency in that language.

Just imagine that there are parts of a lecture where one or two terms might make the entire context confusing. By using Cogi’s lightweight application, a student can later clarify the meaning of those terms, and re-listen to just that part of the lecture which may have been difficult.

And, in some situations, having a written transcript of the sound bites further supports the comprehension process, as reading provides another way to digest the information.

How can I get these highlights transcribed?

Many of us would rather read than listen to recorded content.

With membership level services, you can easily request a transcript of a session or a given sound bite. Then you can just read the transcript of a given sound bite. Even better, you can do both, listen to the sound bite as the transcript is displayed in a "teleprompter" type rolling text pane.

And isn’t a picture really worth a thousand words?

Although the sound bites are central to the Cogi concept, augmenting these sound bites with images and video makes the experience much more rich. We just spent 45 minutes discussing a given topic, and we've used the whiteboard to capture many concepts.  Taking a picture of the whiteboard (or even your "old school" paper notes on your note pad) augments the sound bites that were captured.

Who was in that meeting?

You just met with your team, or, as a student, you just went to office hours with your professor or TA. With just a couple of taps, you can add a contact tag for each participant (or at least the important ones). If you have a picture associated with that contact on your mobile device, that picture is displayed during the review state, helping you remember who was there and what was being talked about.

Seriously, do any of us like typing on these mobile devices?

Let’s enter the no typing zone...

We have these mobile devices and the apps associated with them.  For many of us, the last thing that we want to do is start typing on this small device. One key theme with the Cogi application is to be able to do so many things with a tap or a swipe such that the minimum amount of typing or interacting with the application is achieved.

You can auto title your session just by adding contact tags for those that participated. You capture the audio with just a tap of the Cogi button. A couple of photos and you have the content of that meeting from the whiteboard.

And, does anyone really read manuals?

We don’t think so...

With Cogi, you get immediate and intuitive helps screens.  For many application views, you’ll see a help icon that you can tap to get further clarity on what’s going on.
story_txt:
Stay engaged in the conversation.

Writing or typing takes your attention away from what's going on around you. Cogi lets you take down what was just said with a single finger tap, so your attention can stay with the room.
How does it work?

Cogi keeps the last few moments of audio buffered. When someone says something interesting, just tap the highlight button and Cogi backs up to capture and save what was just said. When the moment has passed, just tap again and Cogi will stop highlighting. You can have as many highlights in a session as you like.
Real screenshots from a real app available on the Google Play Store.
Spend less time reviewing.

Since Cogi only records the important moments, you can review exactly what was said without wasting time on all the jibber-jabber. Attach photos, videos and even text notes (if you’re still into that sort of thing). You can review images, transcriptions and text notes while listening to your highlights. You can also add tags and contacts to your sessions to give even more context.
No joke, you can take Cogi home today with nothing down and zero interest... ever... because it’s free.

How do our early adopters like it?

“Play Store is clogged with apps that reinvent the wheel (same or less features then built-in stock app). Recording apps are no exception. The Cogi recording app on the other hand is one of those gems that offers something new to the table. For this I give "Cogi" 5+ well deserved stars.”

–

Farbror F.


“Unbelievably useful app. Brilliant, simple idea and very useful app. Strangely enough, even though I needed something like this many times (and I'm certainly not the only one), I couldn't find anything even remotely useful. Congratulations.”

–

Robert P.


“Perfect.
I would pay for this! Perfect.”

–

Francois B.
“So far... awesome. Recording every minute of a board meeting was nuts. This is awesome…”

–

David B.


"Best I Ever Had The Cogi app is a masterpiece. I think I've been missing something great like this when at a seminar last week and before that too. This app is one of its kind in the play store. Thank you very much for building Cogi for us."

-

Jay E.


"This is so beautifully simple yet very high quality! The whole app runs so smoothly without any problems what so ever! It's very easy to use and to learn how to put together really useful audio clips and attach things like pictures to them! I can't wait to see what features are going to be added in the future but saying that, I would have no complaints if there weren't any at all!"

-

Josh B.


“Best note taking app! Ever! Simply the best app for note taking! Initially thought frequent click of the button should yield different clips but it doesn't. The developers were indeed right in combining the highlights if they were close enough. Thanks for this app! Looking forward to great updates!”
 
–

Nikhil P.


“Excellent! 
It is indeed better than notes!”

Download the Cogi App for Android


So, here’s what we’ve done so far...

Over the past several years, the Cogi team has put in a ton of work and has developed substantial technology, including:


An MVP Android app with a great experience, available here.
An equivalent iPhone alpha, available very soon.
Telephone infrastructure to support conference bridging.
Workflow software to provide high quality, fast turnaround, 
cost effective transcription, with better than 98% accuracy for adequate-quality audio.
Media storage within Cogi's cloud infrastructure in support of user's captured content.

And here’s what we still need to do...

We need your help to complete and release our solution.  
Here are the project goals:


Complete the development of our iPhone application.
Integrate the iPhone and Android mobile solutions with the 
existing back-end services, including telephone infrastructure and our cloud-based transcription engine.
Expand our media systems to support the new media types
that are included in the new mobile applications, namely image and eventually video content.
Expand our language localizations to Spanish, Portuguese, French, German and Russian, allowing us to support a more diverse user community.
Fund the initial market launch campaigns.

A very technical diagram that explains everything.
Campaign Perks

All who participate in this campaign are invited to the exclusive Cogi Membership Beta, where the extended services are enabled and launched.  These extended capabilities include media storage in the cloud, the ability to use Cogi on phone calls, and high-quality transcription of the audio highlights.  The duration of each membership level is defined, from six months to two years. Campaign members also get special discounted pricing on transcription and telephony for the duration of their memberships.
Standard Cogi Membership
Cogi is free to download and free to use. However, a Cogi membership gives you access to our premium features, such as: transcription, telephony, cloud storage and more.

Campaign Schedule

We are working on all facets of our solutions, and the following is the high-level schedule for each phase of the service launch:

Who are we?

Cogi was formed by a group of technologists and entrepreneurs who have worked in the communications space for their entire careers.  The pain point of trying to capture the important points from a meeting, a lecture, and especially a phone call led to the creation of a communications platform specifically designed to make it trivial for anyone to capture these ideas, and just as importantly, be able to leverage that content.


And, as we all know, in today’s world, our lives are inundated with images and sounds… So, the application can capture the highlights of what we see and hear.  Think of this as a highlight reel for your day, whether you are a student attending lectures all day or, like the rest of us, participating in meetings or various phone calls throughout our day.



Our goals are to make it easier for everyone to leverage what they see and hear, all the while ensuring that the focus can remain on the conversations at-hand and not on the tools we have created.  We believe this is a big problem that faces so many of us, and we are confident that we are delivering a most compelling solution.

Let us know what you think!

Email us at feedback@cogi.com to let us know what you think about the applications or
ideas that you might have to improve the services we are delivering.

Let’s enter the no typing zone...


We have these mobile devices and the apps associated with them.  For many of us, the last thing that we want to do is start typing on this small device. One key theme with the Cogi application is to be able to do so many things with a tap or a swipe such that the minimum amount of typing or interacting with the application is achieved.


You can auto title your session just by adding contact tags for those that participated. You capture the audio with just a tap of the Cogi button. A couple of photos and you have the content of that meeting from the whiteboard.

And, does anyone really read manuals?

We don’t think so...


With Cogi, you get immediate and intuitive helps screens.  For many application views, you’ll see a help icon that you can tap to get further clarity on what’s going on.

story:
µ-nex

A 100% Arduino IDE compatible, 32KB USB development board small enough to fit on your fingertips and cheap enough to leave in any project.

NOTE: In case you have forgotten to add shipping charges while pledging. Please make another contribution equaling the shipping charges (using the same e-mail ID previously used), and DO NOT select any perk. Sorry for any confusion.

Story so far: u-nex? What? Why?
Having used several development boards over the years we soon realized that most of them are designed to be used for a single purpose. Having hacked some to increase functionality, we reasoned that not all boards would easily allow this and soon realized the need for boards which are feature rich, cost effective, yet easy to use and deploy in numerous applications. We set out to design such boards and this is where it has led us, our first pit-stop: The µ-nex.

The u-nex is a very compact Arduino compatible board designed around the Atmega328p micro-controller. It features 32KB of flash memory with ALL the micro-controller pins being brought out to enable you to build just about anything you would want to build with an 8-bit micro-controller from autonomous flying vehicles to LED cubes. Designed from the ground up to give you maximum possible versatility. 

It can be used as an Arduino development board, AVR development board, FTDI breakout board or even an AVR programmer. With on-board USB, it’s a breeze to design, test and deploy your projects.

And that’s not all. At the heart of this campaign and as well as our goals, we aim to give you a high quality product at a low cost so that you don’t have to think twice about leaving this board in your projects.

We have two variants, one targeted for development, the other is a lite version for deployment. Though the specifications are the same, the lite version excludes on-board USB and is priced at a lower cost making it perfect for all those applications which need a low cost set-up.

How so cheap?
We are a team of independent designers and our products are either sold directly by us or our direct distributors. This enables us to pass on the savings to you as we do not have to pay royalty to any third party to host/market the products on our behalf.

We have also carefully selected our manufacturers and vendors who are willing to provide their services at minimal margins keeping in mind the production volumes we need.

Features and Specifications:
  • Small size at just 17.78mm x 35.00mm
  • 8-bit Atmega328p Micro-controller
  • Industry standard USB to serial converter with drivers for Windows/Mac/Linux
  • Clock speed 16MHz
  • Hardware SPI & I2C
  • External power or USB power
  • Input voltage range 7-12V
  • Breadboard compatible
  • On board 5V,1A regulator, with supply to breadboard
  • 14 Digital I/O Pins (of which 6 provide PWM output)
  • 8 Analog Input Pins
  • External ADC reference pin
  • Power LED, serial LEDs, user configurable LED
  • Compatible with Arduino IDE for Windows/Mac/Linux
  • 32KB of programmable flash memory (30KB program code space if using Arduino boot-loader)
  • SRAM 2KB
  • EEPROM 1KB

100% Arduino IDE compatible: We ♥ open source

The u-nex wasn’t conceptualized to be just another development board but to give back a great product to the entire open source community.

The board is designed around the Atmega328p micro-controller which is widely used in several Arduino boards, and gives you great community support as well as numerous extension boards to enable you to quickly develop and deploy your ideas.

Arduino Shields compatible:

We have also designed a shield to make the u-nex compatible with ALL existing arduino shields so that you don’t have to re-write the firmware for any of your existing products nor have to purchase additional hardware.

Open hardware:

u-nex is an open source product. You will have access to all the design files and any other material that you would need to make your own u-nex or a variant of it to suit your needs.

On-board USB:

USB is ubiquitous and was #1 on our feature list and we didn’t want to cheap out and give you a USB solution which works sometimes and doesn’t at others, so we’ve gone ALL THE WAY for you by incorporating an industry standard USB chip for seamless communication with any modern computer along with drivers for Windows/Mac/Linux; so you don’t have any hassles and the USB works for you ALL THE TIME! Because you deserve the best!

µ-nex - lite: For those times when you don’t need dedicated on-board USB. It has all the features of the main board but lacks the on-board USB chip. The external header pins are directly connected to the main micro-controller so that you can program the same using another u-nex or an FTDI cable if you have one handy.

Programming options:

On-board USB: The fully featured u-nex can be programmed using the Arduino IDE or any other compatible programmer. It’s hassle free: just plug in the USB cable, select the right COM port in the IDE and you are good to go. Yes it's THAT SIMPLE!

External FTDI: The u-nex lite can be programmed using an external FTDI cable or another fully featured u-nex. You can buy just one fully featured u-nex and use it to program the rest. Now isn’t that clever design?

AVR ICSP: For all the techies out there, both the variants of the u-nex can be programmed using the traditional AVR ICSP tool. 6-pin or 10-pin programmer you ask?? Use whichever one you have! The ICSP shield features both the connectors so that eliminates your headaches further. The ICSP shield is designed to enable you to use it as a 10-pin to 6-pin connector, neat right?

Use it as a FTDI breakout board:

The u-nex has a solder jumper on the reverse side for the serial lines, Tx & Rx. You can use them to configure the board to act as a FTDI breakout board. It essentially connects the FTDI chip serial lines to either the on-board chip or header pins.

Shields:

We’ve designed the following shields with you in mind. 

1.  Arduino Shield Shield (53x92mm): To enable you to interface the u-nex with ALL existing Arduino shields.

2.  Motor Shield (35x42mm): For all you robotics fans out there. It is a small sized board featuring a motor driver to enable you to control 2 motors (4 PWM channels). You can connect two or more shields using jumper wires to drive more motors if you wish.

3.  ICSP Shield (35x45mm): Enables you to program the board as well as debug code using standard AVR tools. You get to use the entire 32KB of code space if you decide to wipe off the boot-loader.

4.  Relay Shield (40x45mm): A compact board useful to interface to high voltage DC/AC equipment as well as to provide isolation.

Expandability/Cascading: All the shields have ALL the pins from the u-nex available as headers so that you can interface other peripherals easily or connect several shields (motor or relay) to increase functionality.

Let us know if you have any other shield which you think could improve your interfacing and we shall be happy to design it based on inputs.

What’s in it for you?

Pledging your support for the u-nex will not only enable us to provide you with this great product but will go a long way in encouraging us to design similar products that will give you functionality along with smaller sizes at very reasonable prices. We will be ever so grateful for the support extended.

Timeline:

Concept and initial design finalization: DONE

Prototype design: DONE

Identification of volume manufacturers and assemblers: DONE

Testing of prototype for compatibility and reliability: DONE

First and consecutive production runs: Few days after completion of campaign. We need you help!

Delivery of boards: To follow production based on batches.

To ensure high quality standards our PCBs are manufactured at certified manufacturers and assembly will take place locally, while testing will be carried out in-house.

Feedback:

We’d love to hear what you have to say. Any feature that you think we could add to benefit a particular niche application? Let us know and maybe we could incorporate/design it for you.

Do let us know about any other shield which you think is hard to source and would be great to accompany the u-nex.

Which color board/LEDs would you prefer?  We shall let our backers decide the same.

Remember, we are all part of this wonderful open-source community, so WHAT’S NOT TO SHARE?

Shipping:

Instead of marking up the price of the product to include free shipping (to select countries), we decided to give you the option of selecting the same.

Please keep in mind that international shipping rates (including duty) end up being very comparable with the cost of this dirt cheap product.

For single unit purchases of u-nex - lite or u-nex, to USA ONLY: Add $5 

International Expedite shipping (FedEx/DHL): Add $60

Regular post:

For all other orders below $150

International shipping: Add $10

Shipping to India: Localized shipping (About $1)

For all orders above $150

International shipping: Add $20

Shipping to India: Localized shipping (About $3)

Rest of the universe: We are still working on this one :-)

Other ways to help:

Even if you are not the kind who could use the u-nex, we ask you to spread the word through social media or any other means available to you. Feel free to like us on Facebook and stay tuned for updates.

story:
As you know we are having a party to raise funds for the continued living and for the burial costs for Gerry.  Gerry has been through an horrendous few years and is reaching the end of his life expectancy (according to his doctors).  He is however currently in great form and his head is in very good shape and the body is behaving pretty well too, given the severity of his illness.  

However, through all sorts of unfortunate circumstances, he is now homeless. He has been staying with friends but is currently living in a damp caravan without power.  He urgently needs to find a home for himself but does not have the resources to even find a deposit for this.  

Gerry has put so many years of his life into the film business and throughout his time working in props those who got to know him generally love him very much!  If all of us who are in that catigory and maybe those who just know him a little can dig into their pockets and just give a little contribution we can help him with the basics of life and death.  A roof over his head and a place to lay his body more permanently when the time comes.

Gerry has chosen a plot in a green graveyard in Wexford as his heart is close to nature and is non religious. See http://www.greengraveyard.com/  He wants to have this organised and paid for so that when the time comes that he skips off he has a place for his body to go.  It is part of who he is that he does not want to leave this to others to deal with and wants it set up.  These things cost money and money is what he does not have - at all!

So if you can't come to the party on the 16th or even if you can maybe you would like to offer a contribution here.  We don't have any prizes for you but thanks will be given in hugs even if they are etheric!

story:
AimCharge updates and innovates the wireless charging stand by implementing a smart tracking technology which guarantees wireless charging at maximum speed irrespective of where you place your phone.

The charging coil inside your device is detected and directs the charging coil inside AimCharge to move with a circular LED indicator to the right place, and then it starts charging the device wirelessly.

Track and charge earbuds and phones.

 With Auto-alignment Technology, 20W Fast Charging Speed and Universal Compatibility, AimCharge lets you literally drop and charge any phone with wireless charging capability. No more Misalignment, Low Speed Charging, Overheat and other less convenient aspects.

Most wireless chargers don’t show you where the coils are, which leaves you trying repeatedly to get your phone charged properly. The worst case is you never notice your phone is misaligned and come back after the whole night to an empty battery. What’s more, your phone could overheat and damage the battery due to misalignment.

Simply drop your device on AimCharge and it will automatically recognize, localize and track its coil for wireless charging with accurate charger alignment and at maximized charging speed. The light ring that moves with the coil indicates its location. The coil will remain where it was the last time for an immediate and effortless speedy wireless charging the next time you place the same phone on it. It’s definitely your most convenient wireless charger.

To quickly and perfectly align the coils for you, an integrated MCU uses a patented algorithm to sample and compare as many as 2,600 power data sets when AimCharge is trying to couple its Tx coil and your device’s Rx coil. The sweet spot is then matched and identified by spotting the maximum transmission power. All this is  performed in just 4 seconds with a position error less than 0.18mm, only 36% of the diameter of a coil.

To achieve the fastest charging speed, it is recommended to use a 18W Type-C adapter or above.

The experimental result was averaged, the real result depends on the phone model.

AimCharge features a smart charging system which can closely monitor the battery level and charging status based on different phone models, and deliver the right amount of power, which tops out at 20W, to the right device during the whole process. No matter what device it is, AimCharge juices it up the fastest and the safest.

AimCharge is guaranteed to work with almost all devices that support wireless charging. In addition to all standard smartphones, it can charge all kinds of earbuds steadily and effortlessly.

No need to worry if your smartphone has a case. AimCharge is compatible with cases that are up to 5mm thick. It means that you don’t have to remove the case to charge your phone.

You can easily activate facial recognition and make video calls in Portrait Orientation, or watch videos in Landscape—all without ever cutting power. You can scroll or view seamlessly while your device powers up.

Auto-Alignment Technology controls temperature to stay below 131℉ (55°C) at all times, fast charging while keeping it cool. It extends your phone’s battery life by preventing overheating and relating damages.

The LED indicator will keep flashing when a foreign object is detected.

AimCharge is sleep-friendly without beep, annoying lights and any other distraction brought by the LED indicator, giving you a sweet sleep. The stand’s small footprint is ideal for bedside tables. And the tiny light on the front indicates the charge state of the device placed on it.

 

Kinglink is a company devoted to producing the best wireless charger that improves user experience. Our vision is to bring more high-quality, convenient, easy-to-use and safe products to every user. AimCharge is the most exciting one we have produced. Now it’s closer to reality and we need your support to make it happen!

story:
Burson product page: Here

Active Head-fi.org discussion thread: Here

Cable+ in Portable Audio

With today’s multi-core high power CPU in our phones, tablets, and laptops, the devices able to process high-resolution music is already in your hands.

However, when connecting these devices to an audio amplifier, the resulting music quality is guaranteed to disappoint, lacking dynamic and soundstage with a blurry vocal and harsh high notes.

Burson understands the capability of today’s mobile devices, and we know they can become high-end media players once their performance bottleneck is removed.

The bottlenecks

There are two bottlenecks preventing your phones, tablets, and laptops, from sounding hi-end. They are the low voltage output of these devices and the 1940 era audio cable connecting them to the audio amplifier.

If we undersupply voltage to a light globe. It will light up, but it will be dim, and far from ideal. The same happens when an audio signal from a low power source component is fed to a high power amplifier, there will still be sound but weak, blurry and distorted.

Specifically, 5 Volt USB powers all mobile devices and laptops. On the other hand, audio components such as your headphone or speaker amplifier are powered by 240 Volt or 110 Vot AC. The output from such low power devices is undersupplying to the high power amplifier, significantly degrading audio performance.

The conventional audio cable was designed in the 1940s and has not changed since. They were meant to transfer audio signal between high voltage devices.

Using such cables to transfer today’s typical low voltage audio signal from mobile devices and laptops results in signal loss and distortion.

This mismatch is the reason why you have to turn up the volume of your amplifier and yet music playback sounds strained, lacking clarity and impact.

Hear Everything

The Burson Cable +, utilises our V5i audio module, the most popular upgrade for audiophiles around the world, it raises the signal level from 5 Volt mobile devices to the standard RCA line level, ensuring a perfect match with any audio amplifiers and active speakers.

The Burson Cable + instantly turns any portable device into a high-end media player. Its improvement to sound quality is instant, significant and provides improvement across the entire audio spectrum. Soundstage becomes wider and deeper. Bass notes carry weight, texture, and impact while vocal and high notes are crisp and transparent; the way music should be.

With Cable+, your mobile device and laptop become truly hi-end media players.

Cable+ in Hi Fi:

Impedance Mismatched? It Has Happened To Us All

When audiophiles listen to their newly purchased components at home, they often find the sound quality doesn’t match up to what they heard in the store. The sonic characteristics that persuaded them into buying the machine in the first place have just vanished. This all too familiar situation, often leads to most audiophiles blaming the remainder of their system for “not being as good as the one in the store”. The end result is often more upgrades and further misinformed or ill-advised investments.

Many audiophiles are not aware that the performance gap between what they hear in the shop and what they hear at home is a direct result of impedance mismatching between the new machine and the rest of their system.

Impedance matching is a complex technical issue in audio as different circuitry designs produce different input and output impedance. What makes it worse, is that the same manufacturer can have different output/input (I/O) impedance standards across their range of products due to design changes/updates. (See table below).

While some manufacturers are willing to disclose the I/O impedance figures, most are not too keen. In the 80s and 90s, most audiophile equipment accurately published them. Nowadays, impedance numbers have disappeared from most spec sheets. The result is an audio market full of confusion, myth, and plenty of frustration. Unless the entire audio system is from the same manufacturer within the same product line, it is most likely that impedance mismatching will exist. Most audiophiles are paying 100% for their systems but are only hearing 70% of its full potential.

The Cable+ Synergises any audio system:

The Burson Cable+ removes any impedance mismatching by acting as an isolation platform between any source components (CD, DVD, Media Player) and downstream amplification (preamp, integrated amp, active speakers). It is designed to Increase signal transmission efficiency and unlock the potential of any system.

What to expect?

Once the Cable+ is in place, sonic details once lost, will be fully reproduced to create a complete experience. Play familiar – very familiar – material, and you will hear the finest details fully resolved, while the fundamentals take on a new level of life and solidity. That “harsh digital sound” replaced by a wider and more three-dimensional soundstage.

Ready for Production and shipping in November 

The Cable+ will come in 3 versions.

3.5mm input / stereo RCA output (perfect for connection between smartphone, tablet, laptop and the stereo amplifier)

stereo RCA input / stereo RCA output (perfect for connection between sound-card, CD player, DAC and the stereo amplifier)

3.5mm input / 3.5mm output (perfect for car audio. connect between smartphone, tablet and the car amplifier)

Perks:

We are again teaming with Audeze, the premium US planar magnetic headphone maker, to deliver the best value-for-money Perks for fellow headphone audio enthusiasts.  The Audeze phones are known to team perfectly with Burson headphone amplifiers.  With the added Cable+, the Burson/Audeze combo teams perfectly with any source equipment.
story_txt:
Burson product page: HereActive Head-fi.org discussion thread: HereCable+ in Portable AudioWith today’s multi-core high power CPU in our phones, tablets, and laptops, the devices able to process high-resolution music is already in your hands.However, when connecting these devices to an audio amplifier, the resulting music quality is guaranteed to disappoint, lacking dynamic and soundstage with a blurry vocal and harsh high notes.Burson understands the capability of today’s mobile devices, and we know they can become high-end media players once their performance bottleneck is removed.The bottlenecksThere are two bottlenecks preventing your phones, tablets, and laptops, from sounding hi-end. They are the low voltage output of these devices and the 1940 era audio cable connecting them to the audio amplifier.If we undersupply voltage to a light globe. It will light up, but it will be dim, and far from ideal. The same happens when an audio signal from a low power source component is fed to a high power amplifier, there will still be sound but weak, blurry and distorted.Specifically, 5 Volt USB powers all mobile devices and laptops. On the other hand, audio components such as your headphone or speaker amplifier are powered by 240 Volt or 110 Vot AC. The output from such low power devices is undersupplying to the high power amplifier, significantly degrading audio performance.The conventional audio cable was designed in the 1940s and has not changed since. They were meant to transfer audio signal between high voltage devices.
Using such cables to transfer today’s typical low voltage audio signal from mobile devices and laptops results in signal loss and distortion.
This mismatch is the reason why you have to turn up the volume of your amplifier and yet music playback sounds strained, lacking clarity and impact.
Hear EverythingThe Burson Cable +, utilises our V5i audio module, the most popular upgrade for audiophiles around the world, it raises the signal level from 5 Volt mobile devices to the standard RCA line level, ensuring a perfect match with any audio amplifiers and active speakers.The Burson Cable + instantly turns any portable device into a high-end media player. Its improvement to sound quality is instant, significant and provides improvement across the entire audio spectrum. Soundstage becomes wider and deeper. Bass notes carry weight, texture, and impact while vocal and high notes are crisp and transparent; the way music should be.With Cable+, your mobile device and laptop become truly hi-end media players.Cable+ in Hi Fi:Impedance Mismatched?
